p: Data were presented as mean ± S.E.M. or as IC 50 values with 95% confidence intervals obtained by nonlinear regressions. The differences between the experimental groups were compared through analysis of variance (ANOVA) followed by the Student–Newman–Keuls test ( p < 0.05). All statistical analyses were performed using the GraphPad Prism (Intuitive Software for Science; San Diego, CA, USA).
